value: {"luggage_lockers":{"Santarém Airport":"Airport Lockers provides luggage storage services at Santarém Airport. They have multiple locations within the airport for easy access. Prices start at R$10 per day for a small locker. They also offer discounts for longer storage periods.","Santarém Bus Station":"The bus station in Santarém has luggage lockers available for travelers. The lockers are operated by the station staff and prices vary depending on the size of the locker and duration of storage. It is a convenient option for those traveling by bus.","Santarém City Center":"There are several hotels and hostels in the city center of Santarém that offer luggage storage services for their guests. Prices and availability may vary depending on the establishment. It is recommended to inquire with the accommodation provider directly."}}

type: {"type": "object", "properties": {"snacks": {"type": "object", "properties": {"Empada de camar\u00e3o": {"type": "string"}, "Tapioca com queijo coalho": {"type": "string"}, "A\u00e7a\u00ed na tigela": {"type": "string"}, "Pastel de queijo": {"type": "string"}, "Pamonha": {"type": "string"}}}}}
value: {"snacks":{"Empada de camarão":"A savory pastry filled with shrimp,onions,and seasonings,a popular snack in Santarém.","Tapioca com queijo coalho":"Tapioca flour cooked on a griddle with cheese,creating a crispy and cheesy snack.","Açaí na tigela":"A popular Brazilian snack made from frozen açaí berries blended with banana and topped with granola and fruits.","Pastel de queijo":"A fried pastry filled with cheese,a simple yet delicious snack enjoyed by locals and tourists alike.","Pamonha":"A traditional Brazilian snack made from ground corn and wrapped in corn husks,often sweetened with sugar or filled with cheese."}}

{"airport_to_main_area":{"Taxi":"Taking a taxi is the most convenient and quickest way to get from the airport to the main area in Santarém. Taxis are readily available outside the airport terminal and can take you directly to your destination.","Ride Share":"Using a ride-sharing service like Uber or Lyft is another convenient option for getting from the airport to the main area in Santarém. Simply request a ride through the app and wait for your driver to pick you up at the designated location.","Airport Shuttle Bus":"Some airports offer shuttle bus services that transport passengers from the airport to various locations in the city. Check with the airport information desk to see if there is a shuttle bus service available for transportation to the main area in Santarém.","Train":"There is no direct train service from the airport to the main area in Santarém. It is recommended to use other modes of transportation such as taxis,ride-sharing services,or shuttle buses for a more efficient and convenient journey."}}

{"smoking":"In Santarém,Brazil,smoking is regulated by national laws. Smoking is prohibited in enclosed public spaces and workplaces,including restaurants,bars,and public transportation. There are designated smoking areas in some public places,but these are becoming less common. Violations can result in fines for both the smoker and the establishment.","vaping":"Vaping is subject to similar regulations as smoking in Santarém. The use of e-cigarettes is banned in enclosed public spaces and workplaces. The sale of e-cigarettes and related products is also regulated,and there are restrictions on advertising. Tourists should be cautious and follow the same rules as for smoking.","drugs":"The possession,use,and trafficking of drugs are illegal in Santarém,as in the rest of Brazil. Penalties for drug-related offenses can be severe,including imprisonment. Even small amounts of drugs for personal use can lead to legal trouble. Tourists should avoid any involvement with illegal drugs to avoid serious legal consequences."}

{"payment":{"Cash":"The primary currency accepted in Santarém is the Brazilian Real (BRL). Cash is widely accepted in most establishments,including markets,restaurants,and small businesses.","Credit/Debit Cards":"Major credit and debit cards such as Visa,MasterCard,and American Express are commonly accepted in larger businesses,hotels,and restaurants. However,smaller vendors and local markets may prefer cash.","Mobile Wallet":"Mobile wallet options like PicPay,Mercado Pago,and Nubank are gaining popularity in Santarém. These services allow users to make payments via their smartphones at participating merchants.","Alternative payment":"In Santarém,a local specific payment option is the use of 'boleto bancário,' a popular method for paying bills and making purchases online. Additionally,some local businesses may accept payments through bank transfers directly to their accounts."}}

{"telco":[{"name":"Vivo","details":"Tourists can get a Vivo SIM card at the Vivo store located in Rio Tapajós Shopping or at various authorized resellers throughout Santarém.","link":"https://www.vivo.com.br"},{"name":"TIM","details":"TIM SIM cards are available at the TIM store in Rio Tapajós Shopping and other authorized dealers in Santarém.","link":"https://www.tim.com.br"},{"name":"Claro","details":"Claro SIM cards can be purchased at the Claro store in Rio Tapajós Shopping or from authorized resellers in the city.","link":"https://www.claro.com.br"},{"name":"Oi","details":"Oi SIM cards are available at the Oi store in Rio Tapajós Shopping and other authorized points of sale in Santarém.","link":"https://www.oi.com.br"}]}

{"historical_facts":[{"header":"Foundation of Santarém","description":"Santarém was founded in 1661 by Portuguese Jesuits,making it one of the oldest cities in the Brazilian Amazon region. The city was originally established as a mission to convert the indigenous Tapajós people to Christianity."},{"header":"Meeting of the Waters","description":"One of Santarém's most famous natural phenomena is the 'Meeting of the Waters,' where the blue waters of the Tapajós River meet the muddy waters of the Amazon River without mixing immediately. This creates a striking visual contrast that attracts many visitors."},{"header":"Alter do Chão","description":"Often referred to as the 'Caribbean of the Amazon,' Alter do Chão is a beautiful village near Santarém known for its white sandy beaches and crystal-clear waters. It is a popular destination for both locals and tourists."},{"header":"Cultural Heritage","description":"Santarém is rich in cultural heritage,blending indigenous,Portuguese,and African influences. The city hosts various festivals and events that celebrate its diverse cultural background,including the Sairé Festival,which is one of the oldest cultural events in the Amazon."},{"header":"Economic Hub","description":"Historically,Santarém has been an important economic hub in the Amazon region. The city has a strategic location at the confluence of the Tapajós and Amazon rivers,making it a key center for trade and transportation."},{"header":"Historical Architecture","description":"Santarém boasts several historical buildings that reflect its colonial past. Notable examples include the Church of Our Lady of Conception,which dates back to the 18th century,and the Municipal Market,which showcases traditional Amazonian architecture."},{"header":"Tapajós National Forest","description":"Located near Santarém,the Tapajós National Forest is a protected area that offers a glimpse into the rich biodiversity of the Amazon rainforest. It is a popular destination for eco-tourism and adventure activities like hiking and bird-watching."},{"header":"Indigenous Heritage","description":"The region around Santarém has been inhabited by indigenous peoples for thousands of years. The Tapajós people,in particular,have left a lasting legacy,including archaeological sites and traditional crafts that are still practiced today."},{"header":"River Cruises","description":"Santarém is a popular starting point for river cruises along the Amazon and Tapajós rivers. These cruises offer tourists a unique opportunity to explore the natural beauty and wildlife of the Amazon basin."},{"header":"Local Cuisine","description":"Santarém offers a rich culinary experience that reflects its diverse cultural influences. Local dishes often feature fresh fish from the Amazon River,tropical fruits,and traditional Amazonian ingredients like manioc and açaí."}]}

{"local_phrases":[{"eng_word":"Hello","local_language":"Olá","eng_pronounciation":"oh-LAH"},{"eng_word":"Goodbye","local_language":"Tchau","eng_pronounciation":"chow"},{"eng_word":"Thank you","local_language":"Obrigado (if speaker is male) / Obrigada (if speaker is female)","eng_pronounciation":"oh-bree-GAH-doo / oh-bree-GAH-dah"},{"eng_word":"How much","local_language":"Quanto custa","eng_pronounciation":"KWAHN-too KOOS-tah"},{"eng_word":"Toilet","local_language":"Banheiro","eng_pronounciation":"bahn-YAY-roh"},{"eng_word":"Help me","local_language":"Me ajude","eng_pronounciation":"meh ah-ZHOO-day"},{"eng_word":"Yes","local_language":"Sim","eng_pronounciation":"seem"},{"eng_word":"No","local_language":"Não","eng_pronounciation":"now"},{"eng_word":"Excuse me","local_language":"Com licença","eng_pronounciation":"kohm lee-SEN-sah"}]}
